title: ria-store, git-annex get fails on bare-git.
body:
#### What is the problem?
I have the following use-case: on an HPC I want to install a dataset in a shared ria-store for other lab members to use.
I datalad install the repo in a scratch space, then create a sibling in the ria-store, then I want to prefetch files for the lab members to use.
Ideally, I wouldn't pull the data in the scratch to then push it to the shared storage space. Luckily git-annex seems to work on bare-git https://git-annex.branchable.com/bare_repositories/ .
But when I try to run `git annex get --branch main` while in the bare-git in the ria-store, I get the following error.
```
$ git annex get
git-annex: This repository is not initialized for use by git-annex, but ./annex/objects/ exists, which indicates this repository was used by git-annex before, and may have lost its annex.uuid and annex.version configs. Either set back missing configs, or run git-annex init to initialize with a new uuid.
```
Is there any difference between the ria/ora bare-git and a bare git such as used in the git-annex page above.

Thanks!

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

`git-annex get` on a dataset exported to a ria-store.

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
0.14.0

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)

yes! :D
